messages.subject: Re: Pavel Novak
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks..I am the one sending the info to certain contacts in Poland. Can t guarantee results..but I do know the newspapers are buildng a file, and the police
messages.messageBody:
Thanks..I am the one sending the info to certain "contacts" in Poland.
Can't guarantee results..but I do know the newspapers are buildng a
file, and the police are more interested. A long process..but oneday
he will get nailed.

Brian

messages.subject: Pavel Novak
messages.msgSnippet: Hello again , I am a lurker here, and a member over at SFI. A member was again contacted by this guy. I can t recall who it was working in concert with the
messages.messageBody:
Hello again ,

I am a lurker here, and a member over at SFI.

A member was again contacted by this guy. I can't recall who it was
working in concert with the Polish authorities, but told the SFI
member I would forward the E-mail.

Thanks ,
Marc


[Quote] Bumpin' this thread because I´ve received another email
from our beloved friend:

Dear Sir:

I have a Japanese sword (katana) with the XVIII century blade and I
would
like to sell it for the fee of 400$. I have all the papers which
shows I am
a curent holder of this item. If you think you could have any
interest in
such antique item, please let me know.

With respect.

Tomek

Maritime_archivist@...



Still no creative (yet legal) ideas about how to... discourage him?

Edit: The email came from "Tomasz Nowak". [/quote]
